intro: Fumaria muralis var. major, commonly known as the wall rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often found in walls, cracks, and gardens. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its historical use in traditional medicine.
